meanings.definition: A fierce or destructive attack or assault.
meanings.sent1: The enemy launched a fierce onslaught on our village.
meanings.sent2: The onslaught of heavy rain caused flooding in the streets.
meanings.sent3: The kittens' playful onslaught on the yarn left a mess in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The onslaught of criticism from the media was relentless.
meanings.sent5: The onslaught of snow blanketed the town in white.

meanings.definition: A sudden and overwhelming flood or rush.
meanings.sent1: The sudden onslaught of customers overwhelmed the small shop.
meanings.sent2: The onslaught of emotions hit her all at once.
meanings.sent3: The onslaught of compliments made him blush.
meanings.sent4: The onslaught of memories flooded back to her mind.
meanings.sent5: The onslaught of support from her friends lifted her spirits.
